item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (1372 points | 348 comments)
2. Machine Learning in Production (CMU Course) (84 points | 7 comments)
3. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (786 points | 123 comments)
4. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (240 points | 74 comments)
5. Slack Overflow (50 points | 14 comments)
6. The Vikings also used crampons to avoid slipping on ice (7 points | 1 comment)
7. Using AI for Coding: My Journey with Cline and Large Language Models (111 points | 41 comments)
8. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (167 points | 132 comments)
9. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (147 points | 61 comments)
10. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (648 points | 504 comments)
11. Complexity physics finds crucial tipping points in chess games (20 points | 3 comments)
12. The ocean teems with networks of interconnected bacteria (95 points | 16 comments)
13. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (298 points | 193 comments)
14. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (52 points | 30 comments)
15. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (473 points | 240 comments)
16. Oliver Heaviside and the theory of transmission lines (2021) (228 points | 67 comments)
17. A 20-Year-Old Small Company (6 points | 2 comments)
18. Show HN: I Made an iOS Podcast Player with Racket (178 points | 64 comments)
19. Bilinear down/upsampling, aligning pixel grids, and that infamous GPU half pixel (2021) (106 points | 14 comments)
20. Nvidia’s $589B DeepSeek rout (278 points | 601 comments)
21. A Faster Quantum Fourier Transform (58 points | 3 comments)
22. Highlighting Parts of Lua as Bash (11 points | discuss)
23. I trusted an LLM, now I'm on day 4 of an afternoon project (184 points | 140 comments)
24. Operation Leg – a pilot unlike any other (2020) (162 points | 71 comments)
25. The Curious Case of Quentell (70 points | 5 comments)
26. Show HN: I Created ErisForge, a Python Library for Abliteration of LLMs (100 points | 42 comments)
27. Mineral Oil Cooled PC (2014) (51 points | 48 comments)
28. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (140 points | 50 comments)
29. Peanut Butter Day: Going Nuts over NIST's Standard Reference Peanut Butter (2016) (96 points | 54 comments)
30. A layoff fundamentally changed how I perceive work (897 points | 826 comments)
